questions.question_text: A developer needs to design a process using the REFramework, but without Orchestrator Queues. Which is the correct order of actions the developer needs to do in the Get Transaction Data state in this case?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Read Range is the key...

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A, just read excel once

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. Read Range activity is use to read all the rows in excel.

comments.content: You will need to read the entire excel sheet hence Read range activity to read entire sheet from excel as TransactionData. Reading a row means you'll have to keep on going to the excel for data. So, A is the right answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct for me, correct me if i m wrong

choices.C:
1. Remove the Get Transaction Item activity from GetTransactionData workflow.
2. Add a Read Row activity in GetTransactionData workflow to read the data from a local Excel file.
3. Add the logic required to read the data source only one time.
4. Add the logic required to retrieve only one row from read data each time.
5. Add the logic required to check if all rows/transaction items from the read data have been processed.
choices.A:
1. Remove the Get Transaction Item activity from GetTransactionData workflow.
2. Add a Read Range activity in GetTransactionData workflow to read the data from a local Excel file.
3. Add the logic required to read the data source only one time.
4. Add the logic required to retrieve only one row from read data each time.
5. Add the logic required to check if all rows/transaction items from the read data have been processed.
choices.D:
1. Remove the Get Transaction Item activity from GetTransactionData workflow.
2. Add a Read Row activity in GetTransactionData workflow to read the data from a local Excel file.
3. Add the logic required to read the data source only one time.
4. Add the logic required to check if all rows/transaction items from the read data have been processed.
choices.B:
1. Remove the Get Transaction Item activity from GetTransactionData workflow.
2. Add a Read Range activity in GetTransactionData workflow to read the data from a local Excel file.
3. Add the logic required to read the data source only one time.
4. Add the logic required to retrieve only one row from read data each time.

questions.question_text:
Based on the following exhibit, which output is displayed in the Output panel if Step Out is clicked on the Debug ribbon tab of UiPath Studio?

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer is A, by step out it will execute the main sequence

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct one as it will complete the execution of activities in the current container, before pausing the debugging
There is no qutation marks on Automation. It should be "Automation" otherwise there would be an error. Teset in studio. With qutation markd the answer is A

questions.question_text: Which of the following describes the correct hierarchy of the elements in the Object Repository tree structure?

discussion.content:
True answer is B. The structure of UI libraries created with the Object Browser has the following hierarchy: Application > Version > Screen > UI Element.
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/about-object-repository

Selected Answer: B
True answer is B. The structure of UI libraries created with the Object Browser has the following hierarchy: Application > Version > Screen > UI Element.
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/about-object-repository

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer, just practically verified

Selected Answer: B
answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B. The structure of UI libraries created with the Object Browser has the following hierarchy: Application > Version > Screen > UI Element.

questions.question_text: What is a prerequisite for performing Remote Debugging using an Unattended Robot connection?

choices.C: Studio and the remote robot must be connected to the same Orchestrator tenant.
choices.A: Studio, the remote robot have the same version.
choices.D: TCP/IP connectivity exists between the Studio machine and the remote machine.
choices.B: The same user must be signed in Studio and the remote robot.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Check this link in the "unattended robot connection" section
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/remote-debugging
